A data transfer object (DTO) that represents the response structure for detailed log information in audit operations, containing comprehensive log event data with proper JSON serialization and API documentation annotations.

## Key Components

- **LogDetailsResponse** - Main DTO class with Lombok annotations for automatic getters, setters, constructors, and builder pattern
- **Core Fields**:
  - `toolEventId` - Unique identifier for the tool event
  - `eventType` - Type of event (e.g., authentication_success)
  - `ingestDay` - Date when log was ingested
  - `toolType` - Source tool that generated the log
  - `severity` - Log severity level
  - `userId/deviceId` - Associated user and device identifiers
  - `summary/content` - Brief and detailed log descriptions
  - `timestamp` - Event occurrence time with UTC formatting

## Usage Example

```java
// Building a response object
LogDetailsResponse response = LogDetailsResponse.builder()
    .toolEventId("evt_123456")
    .eventType("authentication_success")
    .ingestDay("2024-01-15")
    .toolType("crowdstrike")
    .severity("INFO")
    .userId("user123")
    .deviceId("device456")
    .summary("User login successful")
    .content("Full authentication log details...")
    .timestamp(Instant.now())
    .build();

// Used typically in REST controllers
@GetMapping("/logs/{id}")
public LogDetailsResponse getLogDetails(@PathVariable String id) {
    return logService.getLogDetails(id);
}
```
